The North Atlantic is colder and saltier, which slows down corrosion. Another consideration is the presence of metal-eating bacteria. If the Gulf of Finland has fewer of these, the Titanic might corrode less.

So, putting it all together, the Gulf of Finland's colder, lower-salinity environment with lower oxygen levels might actually help preserve the Titanic better than its current location. Therefore, yes, the Titanic would be well preserved at the bottom of the Gulf of Finland.
